Reviews.Title: Seller needs to respond to tech calls/Problems in Remote Access Setup
Reviews.Author: CCTVBuyer
Reviews.Content: Expect a bit more trouble with this DVR than others, setting up networking through ports, etc.  Hint approach a DDNS Dynamic setup as you would a dedicated IP, using an extended http port other then 80 for the device (Something other DVRs do not require when using DDNS).The Seller does not provide support and has little knowledge of this product, but the information needed and support is offered by others when they see you are having a problem posted on Amazon.  "Others" being those that actually sell the product to R-Tech and competitors who sell the product under a different model/name.  I Highly suggest going directly to "LTS" for the product and support even if it will cost a few more dollars.  (They are also listed Amazon Sellers).Also suggest not using the program disk with delivered with the product "Toss it in the trash", then go to LTS web site and download "CMS2" software that works on this DVR.R-Tech gets a low rating for poor support and non response, but the product gets a high 4 for a DVR in this price range.This is a great product for the price, but I suggest spending a few dollars extra and buy it from a Seller, more responsive to Buyer's problems and support needs if possible.

Reviews.Title: Was leary after purchasing "Commodo" unit with 4 free cameras. This one supports 4 channels of D1 @ 30fps the Commodo 3fps??
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up although the directions are small. I am currently using it through the hdmi port of my tv and it works great!! Glad I returned the "Commodo" unit with Amazons help. It has some nice features advantages and benifits, I was afraid to purchase it because of technical support issues mentioned here in these reviews.  Bigger box than the zmodo unit and much higher quality unit. I am purchasing cameras now, will update as time passes. Good news so far
